help.name: mris_curvature
help.description: This program will compute the second fundamental form of a cortical surface. It will create two new files <hemi>.<surface>.H and <hemi>.<surface>.K with the mean and Gaussian curvature respectively. When neighrhood size is asked for below, typical value is 2.

optional-flagged.explanation: save curvature files (will only generate screen output without this option)
perform <avgs> iterative averages of curvature measure before saving
set random number generator to seed N
Stand-alone option to save H (mean), K (gaussian), k1, and k2 curvatures to stem.{curvname}.mgz
Stand-alone option to save H mean curvature to stem.H.mgz
Stand-alone option to save K gaussian curvature to stem.K.mgz
Stand-alone option to save k1 (primary principle) curvature to stem.k1.mgz. nbrhdsize typically is 2.
Stand-alone option to save k2 (secondary principle) curvature to stem.k2.mgz. nbrhdsize typically is 2.
Stand-alone option to save k1 and k2 curvature to stem.{k1,k2}.mgz

help.example: mris_curvature lh.pial Compute the curvature and do not produce output files.
mris_curvature -w -a 10 lh.pial Smooth 10 iterations and produce output files.
